Detailed Description

Definition of mathematical macros and typedefs.

Typedef Documentation

typedef plFloat plProbValue

The 'plProbValue' type represents a probability value.

Its actual representation depends on the compilation variables as follows:

  • if 'PL_USE_PLPROBA' is defined, a 'plProbValue' will be an instance of the class 'plProbability' implementing our own representation and arithmetics (see 'plProbability' documentation).
  • Otherwise, a 'plProbValue' will be simply a 'plFoat' (i.e. a 'long double', a 'double' or 'float' depending on the definition of 'PL_LONG_DOUBLE_PRECISION' and 'PL_DOUBLE_PRECISION' compilation variables).

Function Documentation

inline

how many digits to print for float values.

See http://www.open-std.org/JTC1/SC22/WG21/docs/papers/2005/n1822.pdf
